creator: tma@gatehouse.dk
text:
I keep all my Apache config in CVS. This causes problems when I have e.g an

   include /etc/apache/conf.d

because Apache complains that it does not understand "Entries" etc:

   Syntax error on line 1 of /etc/apache/conf.d/CVS/Entries:
   Invalid command 'D/conf.d////', perhaps mis-spelled or defined by 
   a module not included in the server configuration

Suggested solution: Ignore CVS directories inside included directories.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
The next one uses SVN and the next one ...

That's the reason we've introduced the possibility to use wildcards like

Include /etc/conf.d/*.conf.

Just use it. Thanks.
